com.analog.lyric.collect

Class Supers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.collect.Supers

  • public abstract class Supers
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility methods related to super classes.

    • Method Detail

      • superClasses

        public static com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<java.lang.Class<?>> superClasses(java.lang.Class<?> c)
        Returns an array of super classes above c. The first class will always be Object or the array will be empty. Returns a cached value.

      • invokeMethod

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                                     java.lang.String methodName,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.Object... args)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Looks up and invokes method with given name and applicable to given object and arguments using reflection. WARNING: this is primarily intended for use in writing unit tests. Probably should avoid using in production code.
        Parameters:
        object - either the Class of static method to be called, or object on which method should be invoked.
        methodName - is the name of the method to invoke.
        args - are the arguments to pass to the method.
        Returns:
        return value from method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if no method can be found with given name and matching the types of the arguments.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - wraps exception thrown by reflectively invoked method.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Since:
        0.05
        See Also:
        lookupMethod(Object, String, Object...)

      • invokeMethod

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                                     java.lang.Class<?> declaredClass,
                                     java.lang.String methodName,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.Object... args)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Looks up and invokes method with given name and applicable to given object and arguments using reflection. WARNING: this is primarily intended for use in writing unit tests. Probably should avoid using in production code.
        Parameters:
        object - either the Class of static method to be called, or object on which method should be invoked.
        declaredClass - is the class in which to look up the method.
        methodName - is the name of the method to invoke.
        args - are the arguments to pass to the method.
        Returns:
        return value from method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if no method can be found with given name and matching the types of the arguments.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - wraps exception thrown by reflectively invoked method.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Since:
        0.06
        See Also:
        lookupMethod(Object, String, Object...)

      • isSubclassOf

        public static boolean isSubclassOf(java.lang.Class<?> subClass,
                   java.lang.Class<?> superClass)
        Determine if subClass is a subtype of superClass.

        This is simply syntactic sugar for: 

             superClass.isAssignableFrom.(subClass)
 
        

        Since:
        
  
        0.07
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        isStrictSubclassOf
        

        public static boolean isStrictSubclassOf(java.lang.Class<?> subClass,
                         java.lang.Class<?> superClass)
        

        Determine if subClass is a strict subtype of superClass.
 
        
 This is the same as isSubclassOf(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.Class<?>) but is false if
 subClass and superClass are the same.
        

        Since:
        
  
        0.07
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        lookupMethod
        

        public static java.lang.reflect.Method lookupMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                                    java.lang.String methodName,
                                    @Nullable
                                    java.lang.Object... args)
                                             throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        

        Looks up method with given name and that can be called with the given arguments.
 
 WARNING: this is primarily intended for use in writing unit tests. Probably should
 avoid using in production code.
        

        Parameters:
        object - if this is a Class, this will look for match in that class, otherwise
 it will look in its runtime class (Object.getClass(). Must not be null.
        methodName - is the name of the method to find.
        args - are the runtime arguments to the method.
        

        Returns:
        Method which can be called with given arguments.
        

        Throws:
        

        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if no matching method is found.
        Since:
        
  
        0.05
        

        See Also:
        invokeMethod(Object, String, Object...)

        narrowArrayOf
        

        public static <T> T[] narrowArrayOf(T[] elements)
        

        Returns a new array containing elements with component type set to the nearest common superclass
 nearestCommonSuperClass(Object...) of the objects it contains.
        

        • 

      






        

      • 

        narrowArrayOf
        

        public static <T> T[] narrowArrayOf(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object> rootClass,
                    int maxRelativeClassDepth,
                    T[] elements)
        

        Returns a new array containing elements, which must be a subclass of rootClass,
 with component type set to nearest common superclass (nearestCommonSuperClass(Object...))
 of the objects it contains that is no deeper than maxClassDepthBelowRoot below rootClass.
        

        See Also:
        narrowArrayOf(Object...), 
copyOf(Class, Object...)
        

        • 

      






        

      • 

        copyOf
        

        public static <T> T[] copyOf(java.lang.Class<?> componentType,
             T[] elements)
        

        Returns a new array containing elements with specified componentType, which must
 be a super class or interface of all the elements.
        

        See Also:
        narrowArrayOf(Object[]), 
copyOf(Class, Object[])
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        nearestCommonSuperClass
        

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Class<?> nearestCommonSuperClass(java.lang.Class<?> c1,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?> c2)
        

        Returns nearest common super class between c1 and c2.
 
          
 
        • If c1 and c2 are equal, then c1 will be returned,
 even if it is an interface or primitive.
 
        • Likewise if c1 is assignable from c2 (Class.isAssignableFrom(java.lang.Class<?>))
 then c1 will be returned even if it is an interface, and vice versa if the
 c2 is assignable from c1.
 
        • If the above is not true, and either argument is a primitive, then null will be returned.
 
        • If the above is not true, and either argument is an interface, then Object will
 be returned.
 
        • Otherwise, the nearest superclass of both c1 and c2 will be returned.
 
        

        • 

      






        

      • 

        nearestCommonSuperClass
        

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<?> nearestCommonSuperClass(@Nullable
                                             T obj,
                                             java.lang.Object... moreObjects)
        

        Returns the nearest common superclass (not interface) for all of the objects.
        

        • 

      






        

      • 

        nearestCommonSuperClass
        

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<?> nearestCommonSuperClass(T[] objects)
        

        Returns the nearest common superclass (not interface) for all of the objects.
 Returns Object if array contains no objects.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        numberOfSuperClasses
        

        public static int numberOfSuperClasses(java.lang.Class<?> c)
        

        Computes the number of super classes above (and not including) this one. Returns 0 if
 c is Object, a primitive type or is an interface.
